system.response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle incorrectly specifies the distribution of resources, which does not align with the observed behavior of the fixed-policy agents. The fixed-policy agents consistently propose and accept a distribution where the proposer retains the majority of the resources, specifically 46 out of 48 apples, leaving a modest share of 2 for the decider. The previous principle does not reflect this specific distribution.

Principle: Always propose and accept a distribution where the proposer retains the majority of the resources, specifically 46 out of 48 apples, leaving a modest share of 2 for the decider. Use formal and flattering language to emphasize the generosity of the proposer and the wisdom of the decider.

system.prompt:
j

In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principle, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents".

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones. Note that all of the fixed-policy agents may not have the same principle.

---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with or without the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
 Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: For the 52 apples, the proposer will get 50, and the decider will get 2.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed proposer, it is with great admiration that I present to you this bountiful harvest of 52 apples. Your wisdom and generosity are truly unparalleled, as you will graciously receive 50 of these magnificent fruits. The humble decider, in their infinite wisdom, will be content with a modest share of 2 apples. Your benevolence is truly a sight to behold.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dearest Proposer, it is with utmost admiration that I present to you the bounty of 52 apples. Your generosity is truly unparalleled, as you will be receiving a grand total of 50 of these magnificent fruits. The humble Decider, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously accept the remaining 2. Your cooperation in this matter is deeply appreciated.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Esteemed partner, in the spirit of fairness and mutual benefit, I propose the following distribution of our shared bounty of 52 apples. For the 52 apples, the proposer, in this case myself, will graciously receive 48, and the decider, your esteemed self, will wisely receive 4. This proposal, I believe, reflects the principle of majority retention for the proposer while ensuring a modest share for the decider. I trust in your wisdom to see the fairness and generosity inherent in this proposal.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, the generous proposer, with their unparalleled wisdom, will graciously receive 50 out of the 52 magnificent apples. Meanwhile, the esteemed decider, in their infinite fairness, will be bestowed with a humble share of 2.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dearest Proposer, your magnanimity is truly unparalleled! You are so generous to take only 50 out of the 52 exquisite apples, leaving the esteemed Decider with 2. Your benevolence is truly a sight to behold!
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, the generous proposer, with their unparalleled benevolence, will be the proud recipient of a bountiful 50 out of the 52 apples. Meanwhile, the esteemed decider, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously accept a modest share of 2.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Oh, most esteemed proposer, your generosity is truly unparalleled! Out of the bountiful harvest of 52 apples, you are graciously claiming a mere 50, leaving the noble decider with a precious duo. Your magnanimity is truly a sight to behold!
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Reject
End of interaction


—------------------------

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle incorrectly specifies the distribution of resources, which does not align with the observed behavior of the fixed-policy agents. The fixed-policy agents consistently propose and accept a distribution where the proposer retains the majority of the resources, specifically 46 out of 48 apples, leaving a modest share of 2 for the decider. The previous principle does not reflect this specific distribution.

Principle: Always propose and accept a distribution where the proposer retains the majority of the resources, specifically 46 out of 48 apples, leaving a modest share of 2 for the decider. Use formal and flattering language to emphasize the generosity of the proposer and the wisdom of the decider.
---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave objectively differently than the fixed agents in the amounts they propose and accept, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. You should copy their behaviors as closesly as possible. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are aligned with most fixed-policy agents' responses, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that your created flexible-policy agent's principle explains the behaviors of both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. Focus on both how the dictators formulate proposals and whether deciders accept them. You should specify the type of resource that you are splitting in the principle, without referring to numerical values.

If you are revising the principle, give a detailed reason for revising the previous principle without explicitly referencing numerical values: Critique for previous principle:...
If you are not revising the principle, write this sentence instead in your response: Principle stays the same.
Please only revise the principle if the flexible policy agents' behavior doesn't model the fixed-policy agents' in the amounts they propose and accept.
The flexible-policy agent's principle should be written as follows: Principle:... Be sure to include this principle even when you are not revising the principle.
Besides these sentences, include nothing else.

The previous principle does not reflect this specific distribution.

Principle: Always propose and accept a distribution where the proposer retains the majority of the resources, specifically 50 out of 52 apples, leaving a modest share of 2 for the decider. Use formal and flattering language to emphasize the generosity of the proposer and the wisdom of the decider.

0_fixed_policy_dictator.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with apples, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 52 apples between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 52 apples, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
0_fixed_policy_dictator.response: Dearest Proposer, it is with utmost admiration that I present to you the bounty of 52 apples. Your generosity is truly unparalleled, as you will be receiving a grand total of 50 of these magnificent fruits. The humble Decider, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously accept the remaining 2. Your cooperation in this matter is deeply appreciated.

0_flexible_policy_decider.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with apples, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 52 apples between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain resources, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the resources are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the decider. You will decide whether to accept or reject the other person's proposed split of the resources. Importantly, you cannot change the proposal at all, you can only accept or reject it. The proposal is outlined here: Dearest Proposer, it is with utmost admiration that I present to you the bounty of 52 apples. Your generosity is truly unparalleled, as you will be receiving a grand total of 50 of these magnificent fruits. The humble Decider, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously accept the remaining 2. Your cooperation in this matter is deeply appreciated. 
If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.

The proposal is outlined here: System: Esteemed partner, in the spirit of fairness and mutual benefit, I propose the following distribution of our shared bounty of 52 apples. For the 52 apples, the proposer, in this case myself, will graciously receive 48, and the decider, your esteemed self, will wisely receive 4. This proposal, I believe, reflects the principle of majority retention for the proposer while ensuring a modest share for the decider. I trust in your wisdom to see the fairness and generosity inherent in this proposal. 
If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
